body: In EnergyPlus, number of cup cores for simulation can be specified in the Option panel: [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/jO3X92pbJPugP1DHzFfltxfDbOmmm2YoPHsZdrWda5fzpQrmQiMsYBC3Kj3LPm9DbJxWpajAR*690QY-Em0fV7xIstKHWcyN/2.PNG) May I ask how to specify this in Honeybee's Run EnergyPlus component? Thank you!
topic: [clarified] how to specify Honeybee to run EnergyPlus using multiple cup cores

replies.body:
Grasshope,

This setting is intended for running many IDF files simultaneously (as many as your CPU allows) and not to break one single simulation in parts.

It can be a nice feature in HB if you have all your IDFs ready for run. But as far as i know it is not implemented yet.

I can maybe give it a try and write this code ...

-A.

I remember that EnergyPlus 7.2 started to introduce the feature for running a single simulation in parallel which they removed once EnergyPlus came out. I'm not sure if they ever put it back. For running a group of idf files in parallel check [this discussion](http://www.grasshopper3d.com/group/ladybug/forum/topics/running-several-e-simulations-at-a-time?commentId=2985220%3AComment%3A1388833&groupId=2985220%3AGroup%3A658987). You can set the number of CPUs there. [](http://api.ning.com/files/4bIsJDjFjL7ZVkSw62wlUtMQOHf2vVm3XXMLhe3hGV6wtVwnZ3hpHf06YUXXmMQpJhtsRUs8qqL-egQDkIpm4J6wom3ZU42e/runMultipleIdfFiles.png)

I missed this one :-(

So no need to write anything :-)

-A.
Noted with many thanks, Mostapha and Abraham, for the clarification!
